p: The SINV was first isolated from mosquitoes during an epidemic in the village of Sindbis, close to Cairo, Egypt in 1952 [ 271]. Later, the virus was also isolated from skin lesion samples from a woman infected in South Africa [ 286]. Noticeably, SINV outbreaks in the African continent have been reported by South Africa only [ 257]. Later in 1963, an outbreak of similar cases as the women whom the virus was isolated occurred in South Africa and 14 out of 21 (66.6%) patients were serologically diagnosed with SINV infection [ 287].
